name: Mercure Strasbourg Palais des Congres

reviews.text: I liked this hotel. The room was big and clean. Nice view over the city. The bed was excellent. Free parking is great and Tram stop just 1 minute away. We also walked to the city centre 15 min. Breakfast is good but not outstanding. The only negative thing was the lack of FREE WiFi!
reviews.title: Nice hotel to stay!

reviews.text: I stay in hotels many nights per year (>100). I would say I have experience. So when I stopped in Strasbourg for a night and decided to stay at the Holiday Inn, I received an unexpected surprise: payable internet. I discussed this with the hotel staff (reception) and they agreed with me that although in France other Holiday Inn hotels have free internet, this one doesn't. Why, I asked? We don't know. Well, I do; the management of this particular hotels wants the money (Euro10/day or Euro4.50/hour).
reviews.title: Paying for internet access makes this hotel unattractive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I think that in 2012, this hotel should be just like every other hotel and offer free internet. It's what makes it easy for us to stay in touch.
reviews.title: Surprisingly Great! Clean, Comfy, Large Room and Nice Staff

reviews.text: It's location is not very useful either, as there is nothing nearby and one needs a taxi ride into the town, which then begs the question: Why is this called Strasbourg Center? Shouldn't be called Strasbourg off-center?
reviews.title: Perfectly placed

reviews.text: Although the hotel amenities are nice and so are the rooms, its location and chargeable wi-fi makes this hotel unattractive for me. I therefore wouldn't recommend staying here.
reviews.title: Great hotel in a great location

reviews.text: Stayed as family of 4 in one room. Kids enjoyed the swimming pool. Generally comfortable stay, bed fine, bedroom and bathroom clean. showers worked well. Location is same block as the hilton but cheaper than staying at the hilton if you are a family as you can have a room with 2 double beds(fitting family of 4 rather than taking 2 rooms as we had done in the hilton earlier.) tram to centre of old town a block away or you can walk about 20 minutes. easy walk to exposition centre and european parliament. staff is good. free parking (the hilton wanted to charge 19 Euros/day.)
reviews.title: ok location, has swimming pool, ok breakfast and beds

reviews.text: I travelled in September for a business trip in order to attend the EU Parliament plenary session.
reviews.title: Some positive points, but old and overpriced

reviews.text: On the POSITIVE side: it is very close to the European Parliament (8 minutes walk); personnel is polite; the standard room I was given was big and clean; there is a choice of pillows.
reviews.title: Wedding of our daughter

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the NEGATIVE side: the structure is very old; insonorisation is not good - especially due to old windows; there was a strange vibration/noise close to the bed, which I solved by moving the bed; during the plenary weeks it is crazy-overpriced given the overall quality (240euros for a single room); breakfast is served in a depressing, hospital-like lights area and it is expensive as well (19 additional euros).
reviews.title: A lovely find...suited us down to the ground...would stay again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, the Hilton, where I usually go and which is on the other side of the street, offers in my experience a better value for money (but it was full this time...).
reviews.title: Fantastic all round!

reviews.text: we were in hurry and had no hotel. within 1 hour we booked via Internet 2 rooms for 2 couples without any problem. The service on the reception desk as well as in the restaurant was very friendly. The rooms are big and with a good large bed. The shower was exactly according our expectations, new and large. We had a good stay and we will come again. Just the area arround was not so nice but as we stayed only 1 night this was not so important for us
reviews.title: Gutes Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have been in this hotel for the second time, I loved my first stay and for this second one, I read many comments and I do not agree with all of them : the comfort of bed, the cleanliness of the room were perfect, the swimming-pool is big enough; as a matter of fact, the internet is slow and expensive and the breakfast is also expensive. All in all, I will of course go back again in this Holiday Inn because the parking is free, the tram station is near the hotel, the price/benefit/ratio is excellent.
reviews.title: My second stay

reviews.text: We had two night reservation, but left early due to: A/C not working, not a 4 star, musty, meldew smell. This is an old hotel that should be rated a 2 star. We will never stay in another Holiday Inn anywhere in the world, and we travel quite a bit.
reviews.title: Horrible, stay away!

reviews.text: We stayed for two nights and booked by telephone rather than by internet as we have three children and wanted one room rather than two (website specifies maximum of two children per room). No extra charge for baby cot. The family rooms are big enough but the windows open fully which is dangerous for young children and the furniture has sharp corners. Our eldest boy is 6 and while he is a confident swimmer the pool is too deep to be safe for children this young. The breakfast (which was included in the room tariff of 155e per night) was great but the portions on the evening menu in the hotel restaurant are sparse whereas the bar food portions seem to be bigger! The hotel is very clean and staff are friendly with good english. The hotel is about 10 minutes by tram from the train station and maybe another 10 minutes to great parks near the European buildings.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights end April/early May 2011 with wife and two kids (aged 10 and 3).
reviews.title: OK - typcical large chain affair

reviews.text: I describe this hotel as a Corporate style hotel. Big with everything needed from a hotel but without the family feel of smaller hotels. I chose it because I wanted easy access off the Motorway and easy safe on site parking. The bonus is the tram to the centre of Strasbourg is cheap and stops outside the hotel! Great!!
reviews.title: Perfect for dumping the car and easy tram access

reviews.text: I like huge rooms and non cramped bathrooms. Big bed...the covers a little too hot for me. If the internet set-up would just be meeting the to-days expectations. Working on it is not enough...get it fixed and you run a good level,good value business and tourist hotel. The bar service with small food dishes at odd times was great and friendly too. For tow nights ---good for what I needed when the opposite Hilton was full.
reviews.title: Pretty perdictable lodging experience

reviews.text: Hotel sits on a large park-like site that provides easy access to street cars and it's only about a 10 minute walk to the old city area with great shops and restaurants (try Chez Yvonne). Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Rooms were large and comfortable and the windows open for fresh air. The buffet breakfast was very good. Really wish we could stay longer, this city has a lot to offer with the old town, waterways, bike paths, etc. If we have a chance to return we will definitely stay at this hotel again.
reviews.title: Great location in a beautiful city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this location in April, really like the location because its just far enough from the city but still easy to get around. We rented bicycles from the hotel for 9 Euros per day, I think you can get bikes even cheapier in town but we liked the idea of having them available to us directly from the hotel. Their is bus transportation within a very short walk from the hotel, so if you are not into biking then this would be a great alternative.
reviews.title: Great location, easy to get around town

reviews.text: We did not eat bfast at the hotel, we instead decided to go into town to find some bfast places.
reviews.title: Not Great

reviews.text: Spent 1 night there was very comfortable and spacious and clean.
reviews.title: Very Happy with Holiday Inn Strasbourg

reviews.text: Staff very helpfull and welcoming.
reviews.title: Best quality/price ration

reviews.text: Breakfast very nice.
reviews.title: highly recommended
OK location
reviews.text: Good all round value for money place to stay.

reviews.title: Great hotel for a one night stay in Strasbourg
reviews.text: I use this hotel for business reason since 5 years... if i didn't change, there must be a reason ! The hotel is in very good location, close to the highway and to the centre. It has friendly staff that will help you whatsoever...

reviews.title: Holiday Inn was very nice
reviews.text: We stayed at the Holiday Inn, Strasbourg, France, in mid-June 2004. We were supposed to have a room with two double beds, but they gave us an executive room with a king bed, brought in a rollaway and the room had a love seat. (2 parents, 2 teenagers). It worked out fine! The room was quite spacious, nice decor, HUGE completely marble bathroom, iron, minibar, coffee/tea tray, and wonderful customer service. They also have a nice lounge(you can get a bucket of ice from the bartender to take to your room), indoor pool and free internet service in the lobby. Our room rate was 99 Euros through Holiday Inn online. ( not bad for four people).

reviews.title: There are likely better choices
reviews.text: The only downside was the distance from the train station and city center. Definately not within walking distance, but there is a tram stop just outside the hotel and it was fairly easy to use.

reviews.title: A perfect place to stay!
reviews.text: Also, within walking distance of the hotel is a little sandwich shop called Chez Claude. Definately give it a try! We were treated so nice there and had a wonderful meal. This was the highlight of our Strasbourg trip, believe it or not!

aka: Holiday Inn Strasbourg City Centre Hotel Strasbourg
description: Located in the heart of the capital of Alsace, a short walk from the headquarters of the European Institutions, the Concert Hall and Conference Centre, the Mercure Strasbourg Palais des Congrès is the ideal place to stay whether visiting on business or for pleasure. This historic city is very attractive: pedestrianized centre, the Palais de Rohan, Notre-Dame cathedral and “winstubs alsaciennes”.The hotel, renovated in 2010, offers 174 spacious rooms including 26 “Privilege” rooms.Our new restaurant “La Table du 20” offers a light cooking which emphasizes the flavours and the seasonal produce.The Lounge Bar offers an inviting and totally modern setting. A restful and Zen atmosphere, jazz style music in the evening, cocktails and interesting food throughout the day.Free admission to the Health Club will help you relax. Fitness facilities include a sauna, Turkish bath and large indoor pool.A Business Point, open 24 hours a day, provides services for business: Internet access, scanner, photocopies, fax, printer, etc. A Wi-Fi system is installed throughout the hotel.
